intro: Leichhardtia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular leichhardtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The flowers are usually arranged in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and birds.
